item.name: 10 Days in Africa
item.comment: Excellent game to introduce newbies.Can be taught in less than 5 minutes and has immediate and long term replay value.
item.wantpartslist: My copy came without the 'Gabon' tile. Can someone oblige.

item.name: 10 Days in the USA
item.comment: Same as 10 Days in Africa. Seems a tougher game in comparison though. Terrific intro game and lots of family fun.

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Barbados / St. Lucia
Airlines Europe
item.comment: A reworking of Union Pacific with elements of Get the Goods as well. Good tight game with a lot of tension and easy to teach and start playing with newbies.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Excellent family game. Lots of fun.

item.name: Balloon Cup
item.comment: Terrific two player game. A must for those who want to play with their spouse.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Nice little game that can give you a lot of fun.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Play it with your wife!

item.name: Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers
item.comment: The logical next step in the Carcassonne ladder!

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: Excellent game, simple rules and lots of fun.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Definite must for anyone who plays board games!

item.name: China
item.comment: Super simple and tight Area Majority game. Could be an ideal gateway game in this genre.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: Excellent game! My 10 year old is a champion.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
Coco Crazy
item.comment: Excellent game for children!

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: Simple, light and great fun game.

item.name: Drive
item.comment: Good light filler.

item.name: Elasund: The First City
item.comment: After a lot of Settlers & Seafarers this gives a different feel retaining the dice and resource mechanism and adding a lot of nastiness!

item.name: Fearsome Floors
item.comment: Fine game that can even be played solitaire!

item.name: Fist of Dragonstones
item.comment: A combination of characters and auctions. Simple rules and very easy to introduce and have fun with non gamers.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: Terrific intro game. i have played with people who have never played games and found that they took to it and started playing well very very quickly. Must have for all.

item.name: Frank's Zoo
item.comment: Good game to play at home with small kids. My 10 yo daughter and 6 yo son enjoy this with me and the missus.

item.name: Gloria Picktoria
item.comment: Good to play with kids also. Simple and light form of Union Pacific.

item.name: Goa
item.comment: Excellent game. Lots of options and strategies. A bit like Puerto Rico if you are familiar with it. Solid game with great replayability. Plays well with 2 also.

item.name: Hare & Tortoise
item.comment: Fine game, especially for a newbie group and caters to all ages.

item.name: Hart an der Grenze
item.comment: Very light, fun game. Ideal for introducing newbies. But I'd like to play it with 5 or 6 players only though.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
High Society
item.comment: Great gateway auction game. If you like For Sale you'll love this.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
Kingdoms
item.comment: Have the old German edition Auf Heller Und Pfennig - Incredibly simple and terrific light weight game. Classic Knizia!

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: Good game. Takes a bit long for my comfort in a 4/5 player game. Ideal for 3.

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment: Pure fun for all ages!!

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: Someone called it 'Caylus Light' - Great fun introduction to the 'worker placement' mechanism and kids love it!

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.comment: Cannot play without this expansion now!

item.name: Lwenherz
item.comment: Great game! Classic German style with interesting choices and mechanics.

item.name: Maginor
item.comment: Boring game!

item.name: Marrakesh
item.comment: Very good kids game.

item.name: Mille Bornes
item.comment: Superb with young kids. My 5 yearold son loves it.

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: The best intro to auction games

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Jack the Ripper
item.comment: A bit of a learning curve required. Love to play it regularly with my wife.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Murders in the Rue Morgue
The Pillars of the Earth
item.comment: Excellent family game with a good mixture of strategy and a bit of luck. A much lighter introduction to the worker placement mechanic than say Caylus. Game plays best with 4 but not bad with 3.

item.name: Portobello Market
item.comment: Very light and quick game. Easy to explain and ideal gateway game. Lots of options to consider.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: A must for anyone! Terrific game.

item.name: Power Grid: France/Italy
item.comment: Great addition to the original game.

item.name: The Princes of Florence
item.comment: One of the very best games that I have played. So many options, a terrific auction mechanic, lots of planning and still the game can pan out differently!

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: I can understand why it is No 1! Fantastic game. You cannot not have it.

item.name: Railways of the World
item.comment: Excellent must have train game.

item.name: Rat-a-Tat Cat
item.comment: Excellent chidlren's game! As my 9 year old daughter (who consider's herself an adult gamer) said, 'this is good after a Puerto Rico!'

item.name: Reiner Knizia's Amazing Flea Circus
item.comment: Light, fast filler

item.name: Ribbit
item.comment: If you have a five year old get this!

item.name: River Dragons
item.comment: Simple and fun gateway game.

item.name: Samurai
item.comment: Great game!

item.name: San Juan
item.comment: Excellent game! A must for any gamer. If you like Puerto Rico and rate it highly this works great with 2 players!

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment: Decent game that we started out with.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
Spank the Monkey
item.comment: The first game, that I got from outside India.
item.conditiontext: Very good - played a few times.

item.name: Splendor
item.comment: The simplicity, elegance and 'easy to teach' can bring this to the table quite often. The game however seems to lack that something extra

item.name: Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise
Tennis
item.comment: Nice simple game. Lacks depth though.

item.name: Terra
item.comment: Good game for kids. I can play another game in my collection with my 5 year old!

item.name: That's Life!
item.comment: A roll and move game that I actually like. Great for the family.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.comment: Super game. Not very heavy, plenty of choices and plays great with 2.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
item.comment: Excellent expansion to the original. Especially since we enjoy playing the 2 player game so much this gives us the required variety to keep playing it.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Excellent game and a lot of fun even for my 8 year old.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mrklin
item.comment: The best of the TTR series of games so far.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: TTR played best with 4 or 5 players. This scales the game beautifully to 2 or 3 players. Probably the best 3 player adaptation the TTR series.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment: You've had TTR for some time now. You love it. You've played so much that you know the destination tickets by heart. You've probably not played it in a while now. GET THIS!

item.name: Tobago
item.comment: Lovely mix of deduction and push your luck

item.name: Trains
item.comment: First intro to deck builders. Liking the mechanism. Game seems a little too long for 4 players, hits the sweet spot with 3 though.

item.name: Trans Europa
item.comment: Great intro to a train game.

item.name: ZRTZ
item.comment: Excellent strategy game.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment: Good light and fast family game. Also good intro game to Euro newbies.
